info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 3:53AM PST until February 22 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible from Gazelle to Weed, and 10 to 20 inches in the Mount Shasta area. * WHERE...For the Winter Weather Advisory Central Siskiyou County and South Central Siskiyou County, including I-5. Highest snow amounts are most likely north of Anderson Grade toward Hilt and the California Oregon border. For the Winter Storm Watch, Interstate 5 near Weed to south of Dunsmuir, highway 89, including McCloud, and highway 97 northeast of Weed. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday afternoon through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The best chance for brief road snow accumulations will be in the presence of heavier showers this until dark today, then the chance for road snow will be higher shortly after dark through tonight. Snowfall rates Thursday night could approach 1 to 2 inches per hour. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.
